720754f-a.text:
Lafayette Street, at the N.W. corner of White Street (left) shoving a gasoline station under construction at that location. This site was formerly occupied by three small buildings that bore No's. 94 and 95, White Street and No. 90 Lafayette Street. A notice of demolition appeared in the New York Times of
May 25, 1938.
June 12, 1938
P. L. Sperr
720754f-a.folder: Lafayette Street & White Street, Manhattan, NY

720755f-a.text:
Lafayette Street, east side, north from White, across Walker, to Canal Street as viexed north eastward across a new gasoline atation site at the N.W. corner of Lafayette and 4hite Streets. At the right and partially seen in the fire house of the Engine
Co. No. 31 and Battalion No. 2.
June 12, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
720755f-a.folder: Lafayette Street & White Street, Manhattan, NY

724756f-a.text:
White Street, east from and across Lafavette, to axter Streets, and showing proriinently Fire Engine No. 31 and Battalion No. 2 fire house at the N.E. corner of Lafavette and White Streets. Note to the rioht the connecting passageway between the Criminal Courts Bldg. and an office structure housing the District Attorneys office. These will be housed in the new Criminal Courts (and prison) Bldg. that is to be constructed on the blocks to the eaat of the present Cririnal Courts Bldg. The clearance for same is partiaily seen in the right
backmround.
July 4, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
